intro: Sageretia trigyna, commonly known as the three-lobed sageretia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which consist of three leaflets. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in the spring. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Sageretia trigyna is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and along stream banks.
